title: Grenfell-style cladding: how to tell if your property might be unsafe
text:
More than two years on from the Grenfell Tower tragedy, homeowners across the country are still living with potentially combustible cladding on their properties.

A Government fund was launched to help the owners of private blocks pay for the cost of making their buildings safe, but scores of homes have yet to have their cladding replaced.

This newspaper reported in September found that homeowners who live in these buildings are being told that their properties are worthless by property valuers, leaving them unable to sell or switch mortgage provider.

Telegraph Money answers some of your biggest questions.

Does this affect private and council-owned blocks?

Potentially unsafe cladding was applied...
description: More than two years on from the Grenfell Tower tragedy, homeowners across the country are still living with potentially combustible cladding on their properties.
